Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: CAPACITY BUILDING TO SOLVE COMPLEX COMPUTATIONAL CHALLENGES IN AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH - MUTUALLY BUILD INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY IN COMPUTATIONAL BIOSCIENCE AND SCIENTIFIC BIG DATA MANAGEMENT; AND TRAIN A WORKFORCE TO SERVE IN THESE EMERGING SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY FIELDS.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: VERMONT LAW SCHOOL AGRICULTURAL INFORMATION PARTNERSHIP LEGAL RESOURCES SUPPORTING FARMERS AND FOOD PRODUCERS, AND INCREASING FOOD ACCESS - DISSEMINATE OBJECTIVE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS, AS DESIGNATED IN THE FY 2014 FARM BILL, TOWARD THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPREHENSIVE AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY AND INFORMATION NETWORK. THE FOCUS OF THIS PARTNERSHIP ADDRESSES INFORMATION PRODUCTS COVERING LEGAL ISSUES RELATED TO FOOD SAFETY MODERNIZATION ACT (FSMA); BROADENING TOPICAL AREAS OF LAWS INCLUDED IN THE HEALTHY FOOD POLICY DATABASE; LEGAL RESOURCES FOR LOCAL FOOD POLICY MAKERS AND PLANNERS; FOOD HUB OPERATION AND USE; MANAGEMENT OF AGRICULTURAL SURPLUS; AND RURAL FOOD ACCESS.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: VERMONT LAW SCHOOL AGRICULTURAL INFORMATION PARTNERSHIP LEGAL RESOURCES FOR FARM AND ENERGY PRODUCTION AND FARM TO SCHOOL STATE LEGISLATION - ESTABLISH COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE CENTER FOR AGRICULTURE AND FOOD SYSTEMS, VERMONT LAW SCHOOL AND THE USDA'S NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY (NAL) THAT SUPPORTS DISSEMINATION OF OBJECTIVE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS, AS DESIGNATED IN THE FY 2014 FARM BILL. ENSURING SUFFICIENT, HEALTHY FOOD TO FEED A GROWING GLOBAL POPULATION IS A CRITICAL HUMANITARIAN CHALLENGE. THIS PARTNERSHIP WOULD FOCUS ON INFORMATION PRODUCTS IN AREAS SUCH AS THE INTERSECTION OF AGRICULTURE AND ENERGY IN RURAL STATES, LAND TENURE, AND GLEANING.

Award Type: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (B)
Description: IMPROVING SUSTAINABILITY OF FORAGE-BASED PRODUCTION SYSTEMS - OBJECTIVE 1: DETERMINE RELATIONSHIPS OF ERGOT ALKALOIDS TO RECEPTORS IN ANIMAL TISSUES AND SUBSEQUENT EFFECTS ON ANIMAL PHYSIOLOGY, AND THE IMPLICATIONS OF THESE RELATIONSHIPS ON CLEARANCE FROM ANIMAL TISSUES. OBJECTIVE 2: DEVELOP COST-EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT APPROACHES TO ALLEVIATE OR MITIGATE THE ADVERSE EFFECTS OF FESCUE TOXICOSIS ON ANIMAL PHYSIOLOGY AND WELL-BEING. OBJECTIVE 3: DETERMINE THE BIOLOGICAL MECHANISMS USED BY CERTAIN PLANT SECONDARY METABOLITES TO FUNCTION AS ANTIMICROBIALS IN RUMINANTS AND NON-RUMINANTS, AND ASSESS THEIR IMPACT ON ANIMAL HEALTH, PERFORMANCE, AND WELL-BEING. OBJECTIVE 4: IMPROVE THE MANAGEMENT AND USE OF TALL FESCUE AS FORAGE THROUGH IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF INTERACTIONS AMONG TALL FESCUE, ENDOPHYTES AND CLIMATE OBJECTIVE 5: IMPROVE PASTURE SUSTAINABILITY AND ENHANCE ANIMAL NUTRITION, HEALTH AND PERFORMANCE BY EXPLORING AND MANIPULATING PLANT SECONDARY METABOLITES OBJECTIVE 6: IMPROVE FORAGE PRODUCTION, MANAGEMENT AND STORAGE BY EXPLORING AND MANIPULATING RUMINANT AND NON-RUMINANT GASTROINTESTINAL MICROBIOLOGY AND MANIPULATING INTERACTIONS BETWEEN PLANT PRIMARY AND SECONDARY METABOLITES AND THE DIGESTIVE TRACTS. OBJECTIVE 7: IMPROVE THE CONTRIBUTION OF RED CLOVER TO PASTURE QUALITY BY ENHANCING STRESS RESISTANCE AND ROOT INTERACTIONS WITH RHIZOBIUM.

Description: TOWARD DISTRIBUTED KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT FOR LIFE CYCLE PRODUCT SYSTEM MODELS - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PURSUE COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENT OF SPECIFICATIONS, GUIDANCE, AND PROOF OF CONCEPT IMPLEMENTATIONS SUPPORTING A DISTRIBUTED KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT FOR LIFE CYCLE INVENTORY (LCI) AND LIFE CYCLE IMPACT ASSESSMENT (LCIA) DATA USED IN CONDUCTING LIFE CYCLE ASSESSMENT (LCA).

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: DEVELOPING DATA COLLECTION AND CURATION TECHNOLOGY WITHIN OPENLCA - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS COLLABORATION IS TO ENHANCE THE CURRENT VERSION OF THE OPENLCA LCA COLLABORATION SERVER APPLICATION TO INCLUDE DATA CURATION AND ACCESS FUNCTIONALITY. THE PROPOSED CHANGES CONTAIN SUPPORT OF PUBLIC ACCESS OF DATA SETS, EXTENDED COLLABORATION FEATURES SUCH AS COMMENTING, TASK MANAGEMENT AND MESSAGING, AND INTEGRATION OF OPENLCA FORMAT CONVERTING CAPABILITIES.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: ESTABLISHING A DATA CURATION PROGRAM FOR AGRICULTURAL INFORMATION - TO ESTABLISH A COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND, COLLEGE OF INFORMATION STUDIES (ISCHOOL), AND THE USDA'S NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY (NAL) THAT CAPITALIZES ON THE ISCHOOL'S DIGITAL CURATION PROGRAM IN ORDER TO HELP DEVELOP A ROBUST DATA CURATION INFRASTRUCTURE THAT SAFEGUARDS AGRICULTURAL INFORMATION AND PROMOTE THEIR CONTINUED DISCOVERY AND RE-USE THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF NAL'S EXTENSIVE COLLECTIONS, DIGITAL RESOURCES, AND STAFF EXPERTISE.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: COORDINATED DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF THE TRIPAL BIOLOGICAL DATABASE SOFTWARE - DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN THE TRIPAL BIOLOGICAL DATABASE SOFTWARE (HTTP://TRIPAL.INFO/). TRIPAL IS AN OPEN-SOURCE SOFTWARE SOLUTION FOR STORAGE, DISPLAY AND RETRIEVAL OF BIOLOGICAL DATA, AND IS HEAVILY USED BY THE AGRICULTURAL BIOLOGICAL DATABASE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING DATABASES MAINTAINED BY ARS (I5K WORKSPACE@NAL, HTTPS://I5K.NAL.USDA.GOV/) AND THE COOPERATOR (TREEGENES, HTTPS://TREEGENESDB.ORG/). TRIPAL DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE IS A JOINT EFFORT BY THE TRIPAL COMMUNITY (HTTPS://TRIPAL.INFO/COMMUNITY). THIS AGREEMENT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF THE TRIPAL SOFTWARE, INCLUDING CORE MAINTENANCE AND DEVELOPMENT AND RELEASE OF NEW FEATURES OR EXTENSION MODULES.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: IMPROVING SCALABILITY AND INTEROPERABILITY SUPPORT OF LCA COLLABORATION SERVER - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS COLLABORATION IS TO ENHANCE THE CURRENT VERSION OF THE LCA COLLABORATION SERVER APPLICATION TO SUPPORT SCIENTIFIC DATA MANAGEMENT AND DATA SCALING. THE PROPOSED CHANGES CONTAIN SUPPORT OF RESEARCH COLLABORATION TOOLS, PUBLIC ACCESS OF RESEARCH DATA SETS, AND THE PUBLICATION AND MAINTENANCE OF DATA FORMATS AND STANDARDS. THE COLLABORATION SERVER (CS) WAS INITIALLY DEVELOPED TO SUPPORT THE SHARING OF LCA RESEARCH DATA AND MODELS BETWEEN RESEARCHERS IN DIFFERENT LOCATIONS, PROVIDING CENTRALIZED REPOSITORIES OF LCA RESOURCES WITH A ROBUST VERSION CONTROL WORKFLOW. IT WAS IMPLEMENTED AT THE END OF FY2018 AS THE FOUNDATIONAL TECHNOLOGY FOR THE LCA COMMONS WEB PORTAL. THE NAL HAS DEVELOPED AN EXPANDED SET OF USE CASES AND REQUIREMENTS FOR THE CS TECHNOLOGY OVER THE PAST 1.5 YEARS OF CONSISTENT USE AND STAKEHOLDER FEEDBACK FROM THE FEDERAL LCA RESEARCH COMMUNITY. ENHANCEMENTS TO DATA SHARING AND INFORMATION ARCHITECTURE WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE THE GOALS OF THE LCA COMMONS RESEARCH COMMUNITY TOWARDS CONSISTENT LCA METHODS AND ACCESS TO PUBLIC RESEARCH PRODUCTS.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: COORDINATION OF AGBIODATA CONSORTIUM FOR AGRICULTURAL GENETICS, GENOMICS AND BREEDING DATABASES - PROVIDE COORDINATION OF THE FOLLOWING ESSENTIAL AGBIODATA ACTIVITIES: 1) STEERING COMMITTEE ACTIVITIES; 2) REGULARLY SCHEDULED WEBINARS AND DISCUSSION; 3) GRANT WRITING ACTIVITIES; AND 4) FUNDED WORKSHOPS.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: ENVIRONMENT, FOOD, AGRICULTURAL CREDIT, AND RELATED AGRICULTURAL LAW RESEARCH/INFORMATION - COLLABORATE WITH THE USDA AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH SERVICE, NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY, TO FULFILL THE CENTER'S NATIONAL MISSION OF SERVING AS THE NATION'S LEADING SOURCE OF AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION, WITH A FOCUS ON FOOD SAFETY AND FOOD LABELING, ENVIRONMENTAL LAW, FINANCE AND CREDIT, ALONG WITH RELATED ISSUES IMPACTING THROUGHOUT THE AGRICULTURAL SECTOR. THIS COLLABORATION ADDRESSES THE CRITICAL NATIONAL NEED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY OF AUTHORITATIVE, TIMELY, AND OBJECTIVE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION TO SERVE THE NATION'S VAST AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITY. AGRICULTURAL LAW AND FOOD LAW ARE DEFINED BROADLY TO INCLUDE NOT JUST LAND-BASED AGRICULTURE FOOD AND FIBER PRODUCTION AND SYSTEMS BUT ALSO SEAFOOD AND MARINE-BASED PRODUCTION VIA AQUACULTURE AND ENERGY ISSUES.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LAW AND POLICY RESOURCES 2019 - TO PRODUCE AND WIDELY DISSEMINATE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LAW AND POLICY RESEARCH, INFORMATION, AND RESOURCES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS DESIGNATED IN THE FY18 FARM BILL TO FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPREHENSIVE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY AND INFORMATION NETWORK. THE FOCUS OF THIS PARTNERSHIP IS TO COLLECT DATA AND INFORMATION, AND RESEARCH AND DEVELOP RESOURCES AND INFORMATION ADDRESSING LAW AND POLICY ISSUES RELATED TO: FARMERS' MARKETS; TRANSACTIONAL AND OTHER RELATED ISSUES FACED BY FARM AND FOOD OPERATORS AND ENTREPRENUERS; FOOD LABELS; BIODOVERSITY AND THE FOOD SYSTEM; RURAL FOOD INSECURITY; AND NEW PROVISIONS IN THE 2018 FARM BILL.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LAW CENTER AGRICULTURAL INFORMATION PARTNERSHIP LEGAL RESEARCH AND INFORMATION FOR PRODUCERS, ATTORNEYS, AND POLICYMAKERS - ESTABLISH COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LAW CENTER, UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS SYSTEM, AND THE USDA'S NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY (NAL), IN FURTHERANCE OF THE DISSEMINATION OF OBJECTIVE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS, AS SET OUT IN THE 2014 FARM BILL. THIS COLLABORATION ADDRESSES THE CRITICAL NATIONAL NEED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY OF AUTHORITATIVE, TIMELY, AND OBJECTIVE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION TO SERVE THE NATION'S VAST AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITY. AGRICULTURAL LAW AND FOOD LAW ARE DEFINED BROADLY TO INCLUDE NOT JUST LAND-BASED AGRICULTURE FOOD AND FIBER PRODUCTION AND SYSTEMS BUT ALSO SEAFOOD AND MARINE-BASED PRODUCTION VIA AQUACULTURE AND ENERGY ISSUES.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: ORGANIC AGRICULTURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY INFORMATION ACCESS - THE SUSTAINABLE SYSTEMS & COMMUNITIES PROGRAM (SSCP) AT THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY (NAL) IN BELTSVILLE, MARYLAND, WILL PROVIDE FARMERS IN MARYLAND, THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES, AND OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED STATES, ACCESS TO AUTHORITATIVE INFORMATION ON SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL SYSTEMS (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ORGANIC AND SUSTAINABLE FARMING, AQUACULTURE, ENERGY CROPS, AND EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE), AS WELL AS FARM CONSERVATION INFORMATION, INCLUDING INFORMATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE USDA CONSERVATION EFFECTS ASSESSMENT PROJECT (CEAP). THROUGH THE RESOURCES OF BOTH THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY AND UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND EXTENSION, RESEARCHERS, GROWERS, AGRICULTURAL PROFESSIONALS AND OTHERS WILL HAVE ACCESS (VIA THE WEB, EMAIL, ONE-ON-ONE CONSULTATIONS, AND EXTENSION OUTREACH) TO AN EXTENSIVE KNOWLEDGE BASE OF CURRENT AND HISTORIC SUSTAINABLE FARMING SYSTEM AND CONSERVATION PRACTICES. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION ON WHICH TO BASE SOUND FARMING DECISIONS THAT ARE ECONOMICALLY VIABLE, ENVIRONMENTALLY SOUND, AND SOCIALLY ACCEPTABLE.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: DEVELOP ANIMAL WELFARE INFORMATION RESOURCES TO FOSTER 3RS METHOD OF REDUCTION, REFINEMENT, REPLACEMENT OF ANIMAL USE IN RESEARCH, TEACHING, TESTING - COOPERATE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF ANIMAL WELFARE INFORMATION RESOURCES TO FOSTER THE USE OF THE 3RS METHODS OF REDUCTION, REFINEMENT, AND REPLACEMENT IN RESEARCH, TESTING, AND TEACHING USING ANIMALS. THIS PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE FULFILLMENT OF NAL'S CONGRESSIONALLY MANDATED MISSION TO PROVIDE INFORMATION: (1) ON APPROPRIATE METHODS OF ANIMAL CARE AND USE; (2) ON ALTERNATIVES TO THE USE OF LIVE ANIMALS IN RESEARCH; (3) THAT COULD PREVENT UNINTENDED AND UNNECESSARY DUPLICATION OF RESEARCH INVOLVING ANIMALS; AND (4) REGARDING THE INTENT AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE [ANIMAL WELFARE] ACT.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: SERVING THE NATION'S AG & FOOD STAKEHOLDERS: RESEARCH AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON EVOLVING ISSUES IN FOOD, AG FINANCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL LAW - THE OBJECTIVE IS FOR THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LAW CENTER, A UNIT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS SYSTEM DIVISION OF AGRICULTURE, TO COLLABORATE WITH THE USDA AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH SERVICE, NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY. SPECIFICALLY, THE COLLABORATION WILL HELP FULFILL THE CENTER'S NATIONAL MISSION OF SERVING AS THE NATION'S LEADING SOURCE OF AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION, WITH A FOCUS ON THE 2022 FARM BILL, CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL LAW ISSUES, CLIMATE CHANGE AND AGRICULTURE DEVELOPMENTS, FARM FINANCE AND CREDIT, AGRICULTURAL TAXATION, DAIRY ISSUES, AND OTHER AG AND FOOD SYSTEM LEGAL ISSUES IMPACTING THROUGHOUT THE AGRICULTURAL SECTOR. ADDITIONALLY, IT WILL HELP USDA NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY BETTER SERVE ITS STAKEHOLDERS THROUGHOUT USDA AND BEYOND. THIS COLLABORATION ADDRESSES THE CRITICAL NATIONAL NEED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY OF AUTHORITATIVE, TIMELY, AND OBJECTIVE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD LAW RESEARCH AND INFORMATION TO SERVE THE NATION'S VAST AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITY. AGRICULTURAL LAW AND FOOD LAW ARE DEFINED BROADLY TO INCLUDE NOT JUST LAND-BASED AGRICULTURE FOOD AND FIBER PRODUCTION AND SYSTEMS BUT ALSO SEAFOOD AND MARINE-BASED PRODUCTION VIA AQUACULTURE AND ENERGY ISSUES.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LAW AND POLICY RESOURCES 2021 - TO PRODUCE AND WIDELY DISSEMINATE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LAW AND POLICY RESEARCH, INFORMATION, AND RESOURCES THROUGH THE AG LAW PARTNERSHIP TO FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPREHENSIVE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY AND INFORMATION NETWORK. THE FOCUS OF THIS PARTNERSHIP IS TO RESEARCH AND DEVELOP RESOURCES AND INFORMATION ON LOCAL FOOD SYSTEMS AND FOOD ACCESS, FOOD SYSTEMS RESILIENCE, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND REGENERATIVE AGRICULTURE. IN ADDITION, WITH THIS PARTNERSHIP WE WILL IMPROVE THE ACCESSIBILITY OF OUR RESOURCES INCLUDING TRANSLATING TARGETED MATERIALS INTO SPANISH, AND CONTINUE TO DISSEMINATE AND MAINTAIN EXISTING RESOURCES.

Award Type: OTHER REIMBURSABLE, CONTINGENT, INTANGIBLE, OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE
Description: FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LAW AND POLICY RESOURCES 2020 - TO PRODUCE AND WIDELY DISSEMINATE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LAW AND POLICY RESEARCH, INFORMATION, AND RESOURCES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS DESIGNATED IN THE FY18 FARM BILL TO FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPREHENSIVE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL LIBRARY AND INFORMATION NETWORK. THE FOCUS OF THIS PARTNERSHIP IS TO RESEARCH AND DEVELOP RESOURCES AND INFORMATION ON REGULATORY MATTERS SUCH AS COMPLIANCE ISSUES AND APPEALS PROCESSES; TRANSACTIONAL ISSUES IMPACTING FARMERS, FOOD BUSINESSES, AND THE ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT THEM; SEAFOOD SUPPLY CHAINS AND GOVERNANCE; HEIRS' PROPERTY AND FARMLAND ACCESS; SELECTED TOPICS ON ENERGY AND AGRICULTURE; AND OTHER TOPICS INCLUDING PASTURE-BASED FARMING AND GRAZING SYSTEMS, PROVISIONS IN THE 2018 FARM BILL AND PLANT AND CELL-BASED FOODS. IN ADDITION, WITH THIS PARTNERSHIP WE WILL CONTINUE TO DISSEMINATE AND MAINTAIN EXISTING RESOURCES. WE ARE ALSO FOCUSING ON IMPROVING THE ACCESSIBILITY OF OUR RESOURCES, INCLUDING TRANSLATING KEY RESOURCES INTO SPANISH.

Description: ACQUISITION OF GOODS AND SERVICES
